situation.title: Mode of operation
situation.meta_description: Rules for restaurants, pubs, bars and clubs which have to be closed now.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Restaurants, pubs, bars and clubs are now closed. Restaurant gardens are also closed. However, from 06:00 to 20:00 it is possible to have an open takeout window and sell takeaway food. Food deliveries can work all day.

The exception is restaurants that are not for the public - these are typically employee canteens or catering providers of health and social services (e.g. canteens in sick, elderly homes) or prisons. The second exception are the restaurants in accommodation facilities, which provide food to their guests (e.g. breakfast for hotel guests) – these can operate from 06:00 to 20:00.

Drinking alcohol is prohibited in the area of restaurant establishments, their surroundings and in all public places (e.g. parks, stops, housing estates, squares, shops, etc.).

When you are buying takeaway food, have your mouth and nose covered at all times, keep at least 2 meters of distance from other customers and restaurant staff, use disinfectant and prefer card payment. The more we protect ourselves, the sooner we can go back to eating in restaurants.

questions_answers.question: Can I have a wedding party or a wake at a restaurant? No.
Can I have a family party at a restaurant?
Does the ban on restaurants apply to confectioneries, cafes and bakeries?
What facilities are under the ban on the presence of people in the establishment?
questions_answers.value: Restaurants, pubs, bars, clubs, bakeries and cafes.

questions_answers.question: Can I have a takeout window?
questions_answers.value: Yes, from 6:00 to 20:00. Disinfect the takeout window regularly (at least every 2 hours).

questions_answers.question: Can I have my food brought home?
questions_answers.value: Yes, food delivery services can still operate.

questions_answers.question: Are restaurant gardens allowed to be open?
Can fast food restaurants be open?
questions_answers.value: Yes, fast food outlets can sell takeaways (typically through the delivery window or drive through sale) from 6:00 to 8:00. You can also have your order delivered.

questions_answers.question: Do hotel restaurants work?
questions_answers.value: Currently hotels are closed. However, once they are opened, they will be exempt and will be able to provide meals to guests.

questions_answers.question: Do staff canteens work?
questions_answers.value: Yes, staff canteens which are serving only the staff not the public have an exception to the ban.

questions_answers.question: Can I eat my meal in front of the restaurant?
questions_answers.value: Yes, you can consume the meal bought in the restaurant outside, but you must keep the two-meters distance from others. People should avoid clustering, so if it is possible, take your meal home and eat it there.

questions_answers.question: Can a pub quiz take place?
Is it allowed to have live music and dance in the restaurant?
How many people can sit at one table if the restaurants are open?
questions_answers.value: Maximum four people with the exception for members of the same household. When it comes to long tables for more than four, the groups must have at least two meters distance between them.
